captions.text:
They offered me the chance to lead them,
to teach them, to... to be king.

- Uh-huh.
- But my place is here.

- So I swallowed the juice,
said the words and here I am.
- Did you say...

Well, maybe I didn't say every
single, tiny little syllable, no,

You know that story about
how you could've been king?

I, uh, I think
it's kind of cute.

Lady, I'm afraid I'm gonna have
to ask you to leave the store.

[Ash] Sure, I could've
stayed in the past.

title: Army of Darkness (10/10) Movie CLIP - Hail to the King, Baby (1992) HD

comments.author: samdiego

comments.text:
This is a case where the original, darker ending (him waking up hundreds of 
years in the future) absolutely PALES in comparison to this more 
audience-pleasing "mainstream" ending.  The apocalypse ending would've 
deprived us all of ever hearing "Hail to the King, baby."

(Also, there is no earthly reason why Ash needed to throw the shotgun in 
the air before he jumped on the cart, save for the coolness of catching 
it.)﻿

the ending. All hail Ash, the king of cheese! :)

comments.text:
If you think about it both ending are somewhat ambiguous but they have 
similarities.  Ash may have returned to his own time but for some reason 
the Deadites are escalating into populated cities, so the S-mart scene is 
the beginning of the apocalypse. The "I slept too long" ending is the 
aftermath of the Apocalypse.
